verses.text: Then Job answered and said:
Verily ye are the people, And wisdom shall die with you.
But, like you, I have understanding; Who knoweth not things like these?
A laughing-stock to his friend Is become one whose cry God had answered. A laughing-stock is the righteous;
It is tents of robbers that prosper, And those who vex God that are safe– Those who say, "Is not God in my hand?"
But inquire of the beasts – they will teach thee; The birds of the air – they will show thee:
The creatures that crawl – they will teach thee; The fish of the sea – they will tell thee.
For which of them all doth not know That the hand of Jehovah hath wrought this–
In whose hand are all living souls And the breath of all humankind?
Doth not the ear test words As the palate tastes food for itself?
Doth wisdom depend upon years, Understanding on length of days?
With Him is wisdom and might, Understanding and counsel are His.
See! He breaketh down, and who buildeth? Imprisons, and none can set free.
See! He holds back the floods and they dry; Then He hurls them on earth and confounds it.
With Him is strength and achievement; Deceived and deceiver are His.
The wise men of earth He makes foolish; The judges He turns into madmen.
The fetters kings rivet He loosens, And binds their own loins with a chain.
He leadeth priests barefoot away; Ancient families He overturneth.
He removeth the speech of the trusty; The elders He robs of discretion.
He poureth contempt upon princes; He looseth the belt of the strong.
He revealeth the deep things of darkness, The gloom-wrapped He bringeth to light.
He makes nations great and destroys them; Expands them, then hurls them to ruin.
Earth’s chiefs He bereaves of their judgment; They wander in trackles wastes,
Where they grope in the unit darkness, And stagger like drunken men.
